summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office personnel scheduling a meeting to discuss an update on the Epstein case. It shows coordination between law enforcement agencies following Epstein's arrest and death.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Participates in scheduling a meeting regarding an Epstein update, indicating FBI involvement in case coordination.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Initiates the email chain to schedule a general team meeting for an overall discussion and update on the Epstein case.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Coordinating to schedule a meeting to discuss the Epstein case, indicating inter-agency cooperation.

events.title: Proposed Epstein Update Meeting
events.description: A meeting was proposed for Wednesday at 1:00 p.m. among FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office personnel to discuss an update on the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Meeting with Brass Scheduled
events.description: A meeting with 'the brass' (senior officials) was scheduled for Thursday, affecting the availability for the Epstein update discussion.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Law enforcement coordination continued in January 2020 regarding the Epstein case, after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email chain involves an FBI Supervisory Special Agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The purpose was to schedule a 'general team meeting' for an 'overall discussion and update' on the Epstein matter.
References to 'operations' and 'the brass' indicate ongoing investigative activities and high-level oversight.
The document shows the procedural and logistical aspects of inter-agency case management.
